titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, The Different and the Same Video Series
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, The Different and the Same Video Series FA1423
titlestmt.author: Katie Martin

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 17:26:51 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, The Different and the Same Video Series

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to RAC in 2018 by the Ford Foundation and ingested by RAC as Accession 2018:014.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Different and the Same video series was produced by Family Communications, and partially funded by the Ford Foundation, in 1995. Family Communications was started by Fred Rogers and was renamed in his honor after his death. Under its previous name, the company produced Mister Rogers' Neighborhood.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains Videos 1-9 of the Different and the Same series on VHS partially funded by the Ford Foundation. The series was designed to help teachers and students in grades 1-3 talk about, understand, and prevent prejudice utilizing puppets designed by Susan Linn and diverse role models.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.
